titlStmt.titl: Group Velocity Dispersion Curves Measured in Southwestern Canada

citation.biblCit: Wang, Jingchuan; Gu, Yu Jeffrey; Chen, Yunfeng, 2019, "Group Velocity Dispersion Curves Measured in Southwestern Canada", https://doi.org/10.7939/DVN/O826JD, UAL Dataverse, V1

titlStmt.titl: Group Velocity Dispersion Curves Measured in Southwestern Canada

stdyInfo.abstract: We use the frequency-time analysis with a phase-matched filter (Levshin & Ritzwoller, 2001) to measure Rayleigh and Love wave group velocity dispersion curves between 8 and 25 s for the ambient noise cross-correlation of each station pair in southwestern Canada, the Cordillera-Craton transition region in particular. In this data set, there are two Python pickle files, one is for the vertical-vertical (Z-Z) component, and the other is for the transverse-transverse (T-T) component. For any questions, please contact: Jingchuan Wang (jingchuan@ualberta.ca)
A sample Python script to load the data sets looks like as follows:
